Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RNase 6 (Ribonuclease 6; Ribonuclease family, antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; mouse; rodents, mammals, animals; UCSS1a; 4S=S,)

Literature Information.Literature: The amino acid sequence is 47.28% similar toAP2425 human RNase 6.Activity: Active against uropathogenic E. coli (UPEC), E. faecalis, and S. saprophyticus at micromolar concentrations.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed in the BL21 AI strain and purified from inclusion bodies and refolded via dialysis. Updated 8/2023; Jan2024
Literature Information.Author: Becknell B, Eichler TE, Beceiro S, Li B, Easterling RS, Carpenter AR, James CL, McHugh KM, Hains DS, Partida-Sanchez S, Spencer JD.2014
Literature Information.Title: Ribonucleases 6 and 7 have antimicrobial function in the human and murine urinary tract.
